reference.Refstring: Halim, F., & Siahaan, D. (2019, August). Detecting Non-Atomic Requirements in Software Requirements Specifications Using Classification Methods. In 2019 1st International Conference on Cybernetics and Intelligent System (ICORIS) (Vol. 1, pp. 269-273). IEEE.

descriptions.definition: "A requirement can be said to be atomic if the requirement can be fully defined as a system function, features, requirements, abilities, including all information, details, boundaries, and characteristics"

datasets.description: "Requirements statements obtained from various sources including online sources such as ACMs OOPSLA DesignFest"
